text: This is the worst buffet in Las Vegas.  There is no beer or wine included in the overpriced seafood buffet.  They decided that and the seafood were not necessary any longer.  Between the slow cashiers and the crummy food, it's a total waste.

St. Tropez International buffet at the Suncoast Casino is one of the few true best Las Vegas has to offer. Unfortunately! Most of these gems r not within the proximity of the strip or downtown area. But, if U r a true food adventurer. Then U will thank me later for sharing this great local secret with all of U! The only gripe I have with this establishment r the hostesses. They rather spend the work hours talking to one another than taking care of customers. There is especially one which unfortunately I didn't get her name was the rudest of the bunch. The whole time I was asking her a simple question. She just walk on without replying. Even the people sitting near me shake their heads in dissatisfaction at how unprofessional she was. I should have report her to management. But I just don't want one single degenerate to spoil my day!

tuesday (the 29th) night wife went to the buffet, at 3am wednesday morning wife started throwing up, took her to summerlin hospital emergency room. we were there 5 hours, finally was told it looks like food poisoning. never gonna eat there again. would not give them even one star but it wont go lower.
I've been coming to Suncoast 4/14 years I enjoy the staff. You're always friendly very helpful. It makes them in here very enjoyable. And I will continue to the Suncoast.

Wow! I'm surprised at how many people dislike this place. I had a completely different experience of this place. I came here to stay a few nights at the suncoast together with my husband. We saw the advertising for the NY strip steak on the menu. So as a steak lover I thought let's give it a try. I believe we paid $13,99 each. Not bad at all, considering steak is an expensive thing plus all you can eat. Let me tell you the steak was delicious! I've tried a lot of stuff there, including the salad bar and pasta and desert. I went each single day of our stay there because I loved the food. It was fresh and tasty and for $13,99 I think it's an extremely good deal. Also please keep in mind, I am one who loves the Bellagio buffet.

Had lunch again here this week.  The price has gone up to $11.99.  I guess the $6.99 lunch was just  temporary special.  However, if you have one of their B-Connected cards, you would pay just $7.99.  Still a great deal.

Buffet is located in the Suncoast, one of the Boyd Gaming oxygen-tank casinos. We came on a Saturday 1 1/2 hours before closing, the place was empty. The crab legs, pizza, desserts, beverages and service were acceptable, so was the sparse salad bar (the only topping available for your lettuce was kidney beans). Everything else (minimal selection) was inedible. The heat lamp didn't impart any heat to the prime rib, which was lukewarm and awful. I don't think an honest health inspector in possession of a thermometer would have passed it. They had something called "Beef Stomach" which was some slimy substance slathered with pepper and chili so that that was all you could taste, thank heaven for small favors. Even the mashed potatoes and canned gravy, I couldn't eat. We wound up leaving and going to eat somewhere else.

The buffet's closes at eight and the food supposedly stays out till 8:30 PM but by 8 o'clock it's pretty slim pickings. The food is reasonable what's left that late at night not sure what it's like earlier in the day. They should just close earlier if they want to get the food out of there earlier but then probably the same thing would happen?I wish I had a buy one get one free coupon. It would've made it a little better. We had a go through seventh place to find one that didn't have dry food on it.

Hmm, came here for breakfast since very hungry despite mixed reviews and was pleasantly surprised. The buffet had a large amount of typical American breakfast food which was fairly good. Corned beef hash with gravy, diced potatoes were very good. Homefries okay, eggs Benedict was not that great. 

Also had a couple of Mexican dishes which were decent. The buffet also has a salad bar with fairly good variety and a good amount of fruits and desserts.

First impressions: The cashier was very sweet, she complimented my purse and told me how skinny I was. With the B-connected card, I paid $7.56 for lunch on a Monday (including tax and beverage). As soon as I sat down, I was promptly greeted and brought my drink of choice. I perused the choices and began to wonder if I should have listened to the advice of many other Yelpers who highly discouraged others from visiting the buffet. There seemed to be a few good choices, but some items looked pretty unappealing. I proceeded trying to keep an open mind, the buffet was $7 after all! 

I began with the Mongolian BBQ station, excited because my regular Mongolian joint back home had recently closed. I chose my items and was a bit disappointed at their lack of noodles. The man working the station was very nice. While waiting for my plate, I tried to take a look behind the counter. Not fantastically clean, but not horrible, nothing crawling around at least! I saw nothing that made me run out. Once I started on my plate, I began to wonder more and more if I should have risked this place. The meat (beef and chicken) were quite bland (probably because teriyaki sauce was not poured onto the food until right before it touched the plate). Since the food wasn't completely awful, I continued with my plate. All complaints aside, the Mongolian BBQ guy did give me an impressive amount of meat. After several bites and sips of soda though, I began to feel a bit queasy. I attributed this to my reading of other reviews claiming food poisoning, probably all in my head. Being unsure about the food, I ate quite slowly. I found it a little weird how quickly the meat on my plate became luke warm/cold but figured that I had just eaten it too slowly. On to another plate! 

Having grown up by the ocean in California, I tend to stay away from seafood in a place like Las Vegas. This seemed like an especially good choice based on other food at the buffet so far.

I grabbed a couple of things from the Chinese food area. The sweet and sour chicken looked pretty good. It had a hint of good flavor but for the most part was just too bland for me (and this is coming from a pretty picky eater who often enjoys bland foods...). The worst thing about the chicken was the temperature though, calling it luke warm would be a generous overstatement. The steamed white rice on the other hand, was fluffy and tasted as it should. It could have been warmer, but maybe that's asking too much here. I ate quite a bit of the plain white rice, all the while wondering if I would regret this meal later. 

Although I had yet to visit the American, Mexican, Italian, or dessert stations, I opted to end my buffet experience in fear that I would spend the rest of my last day in Vegas sick in my room from the buffet food. 

In the end, I did not get sick from eating at the buffet but felt pretty thankful of this. A friend of mine who are her at another point during our trip thinks she got a little sick from eating here, but she wasn't quite sure. 

Even for the fantastic price, I would still suggest avoiding this buffet and eating at another fairly cheap option at Suncoast. "The Game" sports bar has great food and is very reasonably priced.

They say you get what you pay for, RIGHT.   $50 food coupon, Prime Rib and Shrimp Scampi advertised for the month of April,  take the family and go.   Well, the Shrimp Scampi was nothing more than butterfly noodles with the smallest shrimp they could get.   The Prime Rib was not very good either.  The salad bar was missing mixed greens, (although they did have baby spinach leaves)   Standard buffet ware here.  The whole experience was ok, we ate a little of everything and enjoyed each other's company.     The staff is always friendly and helpful.   You get what you pay for.

Ok, well I wasn't expecting this place to be great.  But it is average compared to other places.  I went here for dinner,  Prime rib was pretty well done and dry which is what I eat at buffets.  But it wasn't uneatable.

The service was great, the deserts weren't that bad and they had oysters which I was SCARED to try lol.

So if you want a good buffet in Summerlin, then try the Feast Buffet in Red Rock.  But If you have a 2 for 1 coupon then give this place a try for average food.

The St Tropez Buffet has a manager, Deborah Valenti, that deserves to be commended for her professionalism, understanding,politeness and sense of urgency when addressing customers concern. When we ask to speak to her she came right away. Deborah immediately resolved our issue without question. 

We also had a concern regarding a maintenance person repairing a table and touching all the silverware on the table as he removed it for repair. After the repair he touched all the silverware as he placed it back on the table.  Deborah immediately upon our telling her of this unsanitary act, had the waitress to strip the table, wipe it down and reset it.  This is a concerned manager.  Thanks Deb you're a "GEM"....goes extra mile!

We went to Friday night's Seafood Buffet and I'm here to tell you it was EXCELLENT!  We have eaten at this buffet in the past, but I think they have improved the food since the last time.  We got there at 4pm (when it opens for dinner) and everything was very fresh and delicious!  They have a very good selection of food.  I really want to express how great the Mongolian grill food was prepared by Juan (grill cook).  He did an excellent job of cooking the vegetables, meat, and shrimp PERFECTLY!  What he prepared alone was worth the price of the buffet!   I would go back to this buffet again in a heartbeat, and will recommend it to many of my friends.  Simply Delicious.

If I could, I would give this buffet 0 stars or less. The chef, I don't know his name, is an entitled piece of crap who thinks he is more important than he is. Today, he went out from behind his "enclosure" to rip a plate from a paying costumer's hands. This came for no justified reason. Shame on him!

I've recovered from my MSG poisoning, so here goes.  WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED TO ONE OF MY FAVORITE BUFFETS IN VEGAS??

In the several times we've been here, no one has ever complained of MSG-related symptoms, and yet after dinner here, my GF had a splitting migraine and both of us felt like we had sawdust in our mouths and were excessively thirsty.

I'm not sure if this is an isolated incident or if something has changed.  Should we chance it again?  Did we piss off the mongolian cook by overloading our vegetable bowl?  Were the waiters spiking our water?  Who knows.

I'm not even going to write about the shoeleather prime rib (or was that shoeleather roast beef?). 

If someone wants to go there and check it out, please post a review.  I want to believe it was isolated and go back, since it's close to our house in Summerlin, but this was just an awful dining experience.

SUNCOAST HATES FAMILIES!!! I took my family of 6 and my brother His family of 8 to the breakfast buffet. Every adult signed up for a players card to get the discount. We went to pay and was told that we can not use the discount to purchase a buffet for a child. So basically the buffet for an adult was $7 but we had to pay $12 in order for our children to come to the buffet. A child who usually eats half as much as what the adults would eat had to pay twice as much. So because of this experience our two families will never return to the Suncoast.

Compromise is an important component in every relationship. Except food.

This buffet, located in the Suncoast casino, is a compromise in every sense. There are far better buffets out there, such as Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood, Studio B at M Resort, and the Cosmopolitan's new Wicked Spoon (blatant plug there). If it's not in your budget, there's the Carnival World Buffet at Rio. Don't want to go to the strip? Try Feast Buffet at Red Rock. Don't feel like driving all the way out to the 215 and Charleston? You've pretty much compromised your way into this.

When you walk in, you'll notice the average age of the clientele is 800. Factor in the staff and it brings it down to 780. The place is small, the staff is not always friendly, or present, and you feel like ordering a Metamucil the moment you walk in.

The food is meh. Decent roast beef and pizza. Small salad bar. Cold fried catfish. Really? The only time catfish should be cold is when you fish it out of the water. I waited for ten minutes for someone at the carving station, and he only came out after I reached for the knife and fork to serve myself. My waitress didn't refill my drinks until (conveniently enough) I was ready to leave and tip out. 

Redeeming qualities: It's cheap and on the Westside.

So take your chance with this buffet if you want to; just remember there's better out there.

I don't go to the Suncoast. Ever. 

I had only been in there on one occasion before yesterday and that was to see Paranormal Activity with some friends. That was almost 3 years ago, and even back then I could see that I definitely wasn't missing much. 

Yesterday, I just so happened to be at Tivoli Village for the first time (I also see I wasn't missing a whole lot there either, but that's a different review), and since none of the restaurants in there appealed to me and the friend I was with, we decided to just drive across the street to the Suncoast. Turns out this was a bad idea.

The whole place just felt very......empty. There was no line for the buffet whatsoever, and when is someone NOT happy about that? That's the gift. What lies within the buffet is the curse. 

Not having to wait in line was nice. The price wasn't bad either, $8.99 to be exact. The service: so-so. Our waitress always had a smile, but she wasn't the most attentive either. The ambiance was quiet. Way too quiet. The place also had this creepy, medieval dungeon like feel to it. *shivers* As for the food? Oh dear.

To begin, let me tell you something funny: the section that was labeled seafood had none whatsoever. It was used for cold cuts and bread. (Yes, you read that right. This is a buffet that has cold cuts.) The stromboli and taquitos were so dry. Quite possibly the blandest sweet potato fries I've ever had. The best part had to be the waffle fries and the spring rolls unfortunately. As for my friend, she claimed her food (which included some of those cold cuts from the "seafood" section) smelled funny and had to stop eating because the smell was making her sick. 

Why 2 stars and not 1? Pumpkin Cheesecake in the dessert section, that's why. Ironically the only buffet I have ever been to which serves it. 

The Final Verdict:

Pros: 
Cheap.
Pumpkin Cheesecake.

Cons:
Generally gross.
Slightly creepy interior. 
Severely lacking in variety. 

Suggestions: Just go to another buffet.

Return factor: Nada, not even for the pumpkin cheesecake.

We ate here twice this weekend.  One was for lunch and one was for dinner.  The menu was almost the same.  There was a little bit more for dinner, but not that much more.  I would say that the lunch was a very good deal for what you get.  With the player's card, it was just $7.99.  It doesn't get much cheaper than that for lunch.  Dinner was $12.99.  That was just OK.  For the price difference, we did not get much more for dinner.  So I would say that the dinner was just an average deal.  Unless you come for the crab on Friday, or the prime rib on Satuday, you will probably get tired of the same food here very quickly.  I haven't tried the Champagne brunch.  I'll try that next time.  Service was very good.  We paid a tip when we paid for dinner, so the servers knew we had already tipped.  I'm not sure if that made a difference in service.

Just terrible! First of all there was only one line to stand in, it happened to say emerald card line only, which I did not have one, but the other side was closed. So im standing in line and a woman behind me asks if I have a an emerald card I said no, then she is complaining to me that she has one, and she is confused why everyone is in one line. Hey it isn't my problem! then she starts telling a man that gets in line how some people don't have a emerald card but they are in this line! He says to her, that's what happens to nice people that follow the rules, so here I am being put down, and talked about thru no fault of mine lol whatever. On to the food, one word Awful! everthing had no flavor, you would think being at a buffet you could find something edible, nope. Food was bland, tasted old, or cold. The Chinese food was the worst to me. It is sad this buffet was one of the best in town, about 10 years ago, not sure why It has gone downhill so bad, I have given several chances the last few years. Next my daughter spilled her drink, so I told a served we had an accident and needed a towel, what do you they give me 3 napkins LOL! Didn't offer to clean the table with a wet towel and clear the ice, so for the remainder of this disaster we sat at a sticky wet ice filled table, This is just a joke, will not becoming back.

their are far better buffets out their.the food was cold.their reuben sanwichs had stale bread.they were fast for drinks.and the greeter was quick to seat us.if you just want to go to a buffet.than this would be it. their breakfast is ok to.. many choices of potaoes.i this time went for lunch

The manager at the buffet Deborah never smiles and she is very rude that I stopped eating there. She does not say hi to locals who are regulars I stopped eating there could of the way she treats people. Love Diana,Darlissa and Lynn.

Good food at an excellent price. Of all the buffets at local casinos, I think this is one of the best values in town. 

While both the Strip casinos and local ones have all been busy trying to find more creative ways to offer less and charge more, St Tropez is the only one I know of that has actually improved the quality of what they offer.

The salad bar is well stocked and fresh (although it'd be great if they served a fresh dressing or two). They have a nice sampling of fruit. They have good soups as well.  Disappointingly, the Chinese station needs a lot of work. Their Chinese soups taste strongly of the cans they came from. 

What is to be applauded is that they have a real seafood station. At lunchtime they have a nice variety of fish and real fried shrimp.

The chef in charge has done a good job balancing offering some tasty fresh food options while staying on a tight budget. 
 
Service overall is friendly and attentive. The only issue is they close the buffet line between meals. It's a real hassle and sometimes creates long lines.

Deborah, one of the manager I always see working, pays close attention to everything and it shows. 

The buffet has improved dramatically over the past year. If you have not tried it lately,  you may want to give it another chance. There's lots of things they could do better but the fact they are trying shines clearly through. In terms of food quality alone, I think this place now runs circles around the Red Rock.

Excellent Buffett. The price was right the food selection was just what I needed and if you go on Friday or Saturday you get crab legs. My personal favorite was the Prime Rib and the mash potatoes. I would make this a 5 star if the dessert was better

This review is for the Veterans' Day lunch experience. 

Not your average day, I expected things to be a clusterFk, much like how RedRock and neighboring restaurants were the day before. There was a line, but it was only a few minutes deep, and with a staff of at least four working the registers, all was well managed. Beyond being well-managed, there was graciousness of hospitality and true civility.

I want to be clear about that here. The majority of my fellow diners were old codgers sporting their Korean and Vietnam war covers and shirts. I was thanked by staff for my service at least three different times, but it was the graciousness with which I saw these other men treated that, on my first visit to Suncoast, made the glowing impression. They were thanked, offered a beer, escorted to their tables, and waited on as if they were high-rollers spending the big bucks instead of sitting down to enjoy a free meal. This is how I like to imagine my grandfather, shuffling in with his cane, would have been treated back in the day for his WWII service. 

Respect. 
Simple acknowledgement.

St. Tropez didn't skimp on the day, either. As my plate suggests, there was a wide variety of items to try, my favorite being the generous filets of swordfish. Swordfish! That pricey, healthy cut so seldom enjoyed even at home was there in bulk. Delish and filling. Side that with some tasty greens, al dente pasta, large Italian sausage, and a tiramisu for dessert? Pleased. 

So thank you, St. Tropez. You did this day right and it was very much appreciated by all.

The cashier Cindel  was very nice. She made us feel welcome. The food is delicious and fresh. So much to choose from. The drink server was also friendly and checked on us continously. My family and I enjoyed our meal. Thank you Cindel!

I didn't review this after my first time here? Weird. 

The prime rib: So gross and odd textured that I didn't even try it this time. 
The ham: mmmmmm..... ham! It was good. 
The cornbread stuffing: you mean cornbread pudding?

Overall, this buffet was ok. Better than that damn Luxor experience, but not better than the Wynn's. Good selection of food, but because I'm afraid of all food prepared in large quantities, I don't try much. 

The best part about the buffet was when some old guy reached for the tongs my boyfriend had in his hand in an attempt to get to the food first. Weird. 

The worst part was the salad bar--which brings up a relevant question: Why are all the salad bars severely lacking at Vegas buffets???? I need more than lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, and croutons to create a salad.
Great spread and a real bargain at $6.99 for breakfast if you have a B Connected players card. But I'm bummed that they no longer offer lox, except on Sunday.

I've been to this buffet for breakfast before, so we decided to try it for our Christmas meal (12.25.17) instead of Red Rock casino. I was surprised upon entering there were NO Christmas decorations at all! It didn't feel as if we were having a holiday meal. There was a bare table to the right of the food stations that could've easily been decorated. (FYI - the dollar store has inexpensive decorations). We overheard the server tell other guests that today was like any other day in terms of the food options. I've been craving Holiday cookies, and again, there was no Holiday shaped cookies, no gingerbread men or holiday themed anything. Having worked in casinos and in F&B I can say that most all restaurants even buffets, change up their menus for all Holidays AND decorate. I don't think I'd come back for any "Holiday" type meal since you don't offer anything different. One other thing I'd like to mention is that I had some of the taco meat in the Mexican station and put it on chips to make nachos. I didn't feel well the remainder of the day and felt like the taco meat was coming back up on me...yuuk

I highly recommend lunch at -tropez-international  Suncoast  buffet.  The quality of food there is A1 ....seafood, Mexican food, American, Italian food. 
the fish was perfect, The shrimp was perfect,  The pork loin was perfect.
 All of the foods they're is fresh .   Very nice salad bar.   Service was great . The people that work there so friendly .    We Live in Las Vegas and will be going there weekly. 
It  it's by far  BETTER then  the. Rampart  buffet , and Red Rock buffet
 And that is a fact . Hope the it will never change

I came here yesterday for the Sunday brunch with my boyfriend for our weekend buffet visit, since he was in town. 

TIP: sign up for the B Connected card and you get a HUUUUUGE discount on the already cheap buffet! 

Free mimosas and champagne for Sunday brunch (less than $13 pp with bconnected card). 

This buffet has a lot to offer, the food is good, however, I think that it's not AS good as Red Rock, however it does have it's own good qualities! The chocolate fondue fountain is a great option, HOWEVER, it wasn't being attended to so some of the fruit was covered by nats. Other than that, everything was good and tasty, there's also a lot less people than at any other buffet (other than stratosphere buffet), so it's nice with how less packed it is.

The buffet is $18.99 seafood/card. There's not much of a selection for seafood. I saw one of the workers replace a ladle submerged in the drawn butter but did not replace the whole bin. I guess he didn't learn or care about contamination.

It's been a few years since I've been here and I am happy to report it's gotten a little better. Most things are edible at least. We arrived around 10:20a on a Saturday morning, which was cutting it close because breakfast ends at 1030. Still, we were able to get some last minute breakfast items before they removed them. Saturday breakfast and lunch are the same price ($8.99) with your players card.

French toast, pancakes and scrambled eggs were solid. Bacon and sausage were good, but the turkey sausage was hard as a rock. Fresh fruit was a hit or miss, but the canned fruit was fine. After 10:30 they shut down pretty much all the stations while they got lunch ready. Lunch started promptly at 11. I found that many of the lunch items were not good. The alfredo sauce, for example, was really lumpy which is never a good sign. The chicken picatta had a gelatinous sauce on top of it which was very off putting, and the fried ravioli were luke warm. Considering lunch had just started you would expect the items to be in good condition and HOT. The salad bar was fresh and the Mongolian station looked promising, although I did not try it. The desert bar was a winner. Fully stocked with various pies, cheesecakes, cookies and gelato. Honestly this isn't the worst buffet I've had and I would likely come back here, but probably for breakfast only.

Mehhhh...really regret eating the food at this buffet. Thank god it was free because my boyfriend's dad is a emerald member. We can on a Friday causes that when they offer crab legs. We sat down quickly and went straight for the crab legs. Hmm come to find out, they don't offer crab legs for the month of October!

So I tried the shrimp and they didn't taste good at all. They were soft and falling apart. I also tried the prime rib and it was dry and tough. The Mongolian site fry was way too salty!

I honestly wouldn't eat here again even if it was free.
Food was bland. Craved turkey was super dry and there's honestly not many choices. Service was nice. Kept are champagne and drinks refilled. Would I come here again?....not a chance.

What a delightful surprise! We have been avoiding the buffet at the Suncoast for years because frankly the food was boring. Not anymore! New menu items and an energized staff make this a go to for lunch and dinner! Kudos to whoever is managing this turnaround!

This breakfast buffet  offers 150 items.  A good deal of them are not recognizable nor identified.  There must be 5 to 6 choices of scrambled eggs that have been beaten to hard pebbles with some awful artificial butter mixed in.  The corn beef hash is salty and on the dry side.  Plenty of meat choices but everything is cold.  I tried this buffet a second time, hopeing to find something that works.  The omelet was well prepared but cooked in some awful tasting oil.  Forget about tasting the egg.  The nova and cream cheese was a success after two attempts.  The cream cheese was in some out of the way place, and the first time around, it's beyond me, what that thick, white, sweet stuff was that I used.  It was awful.  They need to identify this stuff and at least put things in a better place.  At any rate, the coffee was good and the waiters friendly and efficient.  It used to better up to a few years ago.  It's now just too dark, dank and simply not pleasant.

For some reason Me and My Husband always go to Redrock Feasts Buffet and their food is so dry and hard it looks like an old food or over cooked. So we tried St Tropez Buffet @ Suncoast for $6.99 for breakfast WOW their Food are fantastic taste so good and juicy. The Mexican food section are delicious and Their Lunch if you are a pasta lover they have an excellent choices, their seafood soup, the Salmon they cooked it so Juicy. The staff are great especially the cook and the manager name Debbie very nice lady. I complained once and they did it perfectly. Congrats to All of you.

The only buffet option within the Suncoast Hotel. 

The dinner is reasonably priced if you're not particularly looking for something. 

Saturday night is prime rib and shrimp scampi. Not the greatest but not the worst either. 

The other stations are so so. 

If you have a comp then this would be four stars. If you had to pay, it's more of a two and a half but the service that you'll receive rounds it up to three stars and I feel that's fair. 

The plates are cleared the moment you're finished and the drinks are topped off. 

The dining area is comfortable. The seats and booths are well placed. 

The only thing that I didn't like we're the extendable dining tables as they were a bit wobbly and silverware kept falling.

The desserts were decent but not many options to choose from. 

The ice cream wasn't dryers which I prefer and the consistency wasn't right. It's probably their settings. I still finished it though. 

At the end of the day, what it came down to was I came in hungry and left full. 

I didn't feel like I had to stuff my face with everything to justify the cost of free and I left happy just in time to catch my free movie at the theater. 

I'll probably be back here again. 

Thanks!

We ate here because we were staying at Suncoast and it was inexpensive (with the gaming card discount). It's a buffet, so you get the usual buffet food - lots of ethnic choices, but in my opinion, mainly bland.  They also offer soup, salads, and a vast array of desserts-my choice was the scoops of yummy flavored ice creams.  We did try the lobster "add-on" for an additional $4 which my husband said was good for what we paid.  The staff was cheerful & friendly.

The St.Tropez "international " buffet ( lol ) For breakfast good omelets,bagels, and pastries and some items hit or miss. I eat breakfast here mainly because it is not bad, I am sure all the staff cares about is getting this swill out and ready before the morning senior line forms outside the ropes. I got there a couple of mornings right at opening no one had been to the salad bar, yet the lettuce was brown, the spinach was wilted and the leaves were strewn outside the bowl WTF ?

DO not go here for lunch or dinner especially if you actually are paying for it. A medley of low quality food prepared with no care involved and apparently someone's job who supervises this approves again WTF !    As a side note dont waste your time at the cafe Siena it is just as bad !

Uhhhhhhhhh........never ever again period.  If it was free it would still be overly disgusting at best.  If I was Boyd casinos I would close this gross buffet as I could not get out if there fast enough thus the gaming for none of my $$$$ either

Typical buffet.... Cheaper than eating in a regular restaurant. since u can indulge yourself with soup salad dessert and any main  and side dish you can find to your liking..... I do enjoy their gyro station.

I was debating between 3 and 4 stars. It's just, priced really well, food was decent for the most part. 
Nothing to write home about. 

We were hungry, not any more. I wish they had more fresh veggies, but they were closing at 8, and we set down at 7:20 so the tomatoes and cucumbers have seen better days.  The jello was too warm and runny. Some of the desert was dried up. We resisted taking ice cream. Yup, we have to watch what we are eating. 

They had nice selection of the usual food some Italian, some Chinese, etc.  

The server was nice and welcoming. We didn't have to wait in line. So all together it was an ok experience.

Went here for breakfast before watching The Last Jedi on Tuesday morning. There was no line and the food was fresh, I got 2 eggs overeasy made fresh in the far left of the buffet where you can also order omellettes. The eggs benedict is a bit bland which is disappointing but for $6.99 its not bad. The waffles are shaped like hearts and perfect size, the carving station has ham served next to some biscuits that you can pour country gravy on. For the price your selection is not bad, and the server was quick to get my coffee and orange juice. I'll be back soon for another fun experience and great breakfast for the price.

The buffet at the Suncoast is a basic Vegas buffet.  It wasn't particularly crowded when we went which was nice.  They have a decent selection but nothing special or that good.  The service was better than average but the food was just average.  The dessert selection was the best part of the food.  I wouldn't recommend it for dinner, but for kids and for the price it was okay.

I will start by pointing out that buffet food is not the same as traditional restaurant food. Unless you pay more than $50 per person at one of the Strip buffets, you can expect standard buffet fare at any buffet in town.  For the price, the food at the Suncoast buffet, especially the breakfast and Sunday brunch buffet, is better than it needs to be. As a frequent diner at this and other buffets in town, Suncoast does a consistently better job than any of the other "locals" resort buffets.

I suspect some of the negative reviews come from folks who are expecting a four star restaurant dining experience. We have enjoyed dozens of buffet meals at the Suncoast and have always left feeling we got more than our money's worth. If we are in the mood for gourmet dining, we go a traditional restaurant and pay accordingly. For a comfortable, casual buffet with a nice selection and above average quality... and prices cheaper than a burger from In-and-Out,  we go to the Suncoast.

Ok, stopped here twice. Once for lunch, once for breakfast.

Lunch on Saturday - The signs all over the casino advertised an $8.99 buffet. So I walked up and figured I'd try it. First problem - It's only $8.99 if you're a member of the "Connect Players Club", the free in-house gambling loyalty program. If I wanted the $8.99 price I would have to wander off somewhere else in the Casino over to member services or something and sign up for the free loyalty program. I wasn't about to go figure that out (we were staying here on a rock climbing trip - not a gambling trip). So I paid full price, which was almost $15.

For the price, the buffet wasn't that great. Decent amount of choices for lunch type foods. But it was basically just the same as Old Country Buffet. This was not one of those fabled amazing cheap, amazing tasting Vegas buffets of mystery and legend.

On the other hand, everything was rotated in and out quickly so it was always fresh. Everything I tried (Pizza, Turkey, Mashed Potatoes, Veggies, Baked Chicken) was all pretty good. The soda and drinks are not self serve, but the waitress was very quick and friendly and kept us topped up. Overall for lunch I would have given three stars.

Now on Sunday, I'm subtracting a star. Again there were signs all over for a breakfast buffet. $8.99. This time I noticed the asterisk. I figured that was the loyalty card price. Three of us went downstairs anyway, expecting to pay a little more than that since we didn't have the cards, but not much more. I mean it was breakfast after all. So we get down there and are informed that because it's Sunday, there is no breakfast buffet. It's "Champions Brunch" and it's $24.99. Yikes. No way. Based on the food we already tried, there wasn't anything at all that could be good enough to be worth that.

We went to Subway instead and were perfectly happy with breakfast sandwiches.

Our group of approx. 40 had a great breakfast buffet this morning at the St. Tropez Buffet, Suncoast Resort.   The food was tasty and there was a good variety - something for every taste.  We were in an area that was set off to the side and had a feeling of a private room, although we were very close to the buffet food.  The servers couldn't have been more attentive or quick.  I would recommend this location for a group outing or just a good all-you-can-eat experience any day of the week!

They have a great soup and salad bar and the Prime Rib was excellent. There is Chinese, Soul Food, Italian and Mongolian. The assorted desserts are cookies, cheese cake, carrot cake, etc...and there are sugar free versions of the regular desserts. My Husband and Son Love the desserts.

Christmas  buffet was a pleasant  surprise;  champagne, sushi, prime rib, orange chicken, real mashed potatoes, bread pudding and Boston  Cream Pie.  Our server, Ryan, provided exceptional  server, and he's  on Extra Board.

From other casino buffets around Summerlin, St. Tropez Buffet inside Suncoast is the BEST! Inside this buffet they serve many different meals from American, Italian, Chinese, and more.

The BEST part if this buffet would be the DESSERT! In their dessert, they serve many different varieties of cake, ice cream, gellatos, and more. Trust me, IT'S DELICIOUS! 

The staff here are nice and responsive. I recommend coming here because they also have players card price for the buffet and regular price. The players card is FREE to sign up.

Went there last Tuesday, Jul 26 \16. In the morning its just 5 bucks, but in evening it cost more than 30 bucks for adult and a kid....but we decide to try it.  Find out, its way overpriced in dinner time.
Well, salad bar is ok, tomatoes cracked and not -so-fresh but you can find some good stuff.
Tuna salad is NOT fresh and tastes funny, like it is carbonated. BBQ ribs - looks good, suppose to be mild, juicy and falling apart... nope, beware, you bite it and may broke your teeth, it tastes and feels like rubber wheel or something so you can get stuck. Yuck!  Salmon is dry and hard, and even pork chops is hard and slightly savour!
Watermelon bowl empty. Sweet pies all about the same, difference in d√©cor. Cream puffs shell overcooked - so hard , you can cut your mouth with that like with a blade....
No good seafood like sushi or seaweed salad or fried calamari or scallops....  well, no good seafood like in other buffets around. One or two lonely crab legs swimming in big bowl of murky liquid...
About ANY other local buffet (except Silverton casino buffet) is better!
All food honestly doesn't worth that price. And I notice manager with kind-of eastern european name on the badge going around and mixing that food to make it look more attractive - instead of changing it to fresh.
Want some good buffet nearby? Better walk a few hundred feet more and go to the Rampart casino buffet, that way better!  Rampart buffet  have good food - juicy, tasty and fresh -  and sweets different,  just beautiful & awesome!   I will never ever go to Suncoast buffet for dinner again! 
Even Texas & Fiesta casino buffets are better!

I am sorry. I love the Suncoast to play. I love your cocktail waitresses, best in Vegas. Your buffet is not international, it sucks. Really the worse I have ever eaten in the world. I have been in the world....Granted if your staying there and want a cheap meal run go to the Bagel shop in the corner. They have decent food. This is plain gross.Dinner was just gross. I can not explain it more.Over cooked, flavorless, and gross. I am sorry. Huge fan of the Suncoast not your food.

OMG, way way nasty all cold food (thats how you get friggin Tapeworms) and dysentera. surly help, not one employee greeted us with a smile at all. They all must hate their employer.. Nasty-ass food, worse mashed potatoes in the world, tasteless food, garbage way too expensive on sunday $17.95 down the drain. Fried chicken was rubber. the h20 was good and thats it. stay far away

With all the bad Yelp reviews we were not expecting much but for lunch and at $7.99 this buffet was okay. This is a small buffet with an american, mongolian, chinese, mexican, italian and a seafood stations. The service was good with our drinks being refilled and dishes removed quickly.  This is not a fancy Las Vegas strip buffet but it was okay and what you should expect for the price.

I am writing this review on my experience alone and am sure that others may have a different view. 

I had high hopes for this buffet as it looked busy and smelled really good but, upon getting in and trying the food I left a bit disappointed.

The salad bar was awesome and the best part of the meal. The Mongolian food was good once I knew what I was doing. I had a great chat with the amazing lady who ran that station. She made that part of the meal better.

My worst complaint is that the other stations had cold food, it seemed to be left out for quite awhile. I am a huge fan of hot and sour soup usually but, the broth was a cold thick gravy texture that was really gross.

The pizza and dinner rolls were also cold and hard as a rock.
I really felt that if I had other offers or options I would not eat here again. 

My thought is that you should check it out yourself and leave your opinion.

I suggest coming in before it hits 4pm or you will be spending alot more money after 4:30pm.

You get a great selection of choices here.  there's  items from Mongolian, sea food, Chinese food, American food, Mexican food and Italian food.

Nothing really jumps out as amazing but nothing really taste horrible aswell. It's a pretty descent buffet place and it just really depends what time you arrive and how much you will spend for some pretty mediocre buffet food.

I'd give it a zero if I could, one of the worst buffets I've ever gone to in Las Vegas or anywhere for that matter.

You expect lines for a good buffet, but not for the really bad ones. It took 30 minutes to get to the cashier, not so much because there were a lot of people, no. It was due to the comical incompetence of the staff. Four registers and only one working with 7 employees manning the one! Despite there being cashiers and hosts and a manager no one seemed to have ever seen the coupons that all these places have for locals every week, or the comp slips that loyal gamblers get from the casino. Literally every single customer seemed like the end of the world as these people had no idea what to do with the coupons or how to process them.

Meanwhile, a host and a manager are getting into a yelling fight in front of everyone when they could have moved the shouting match 4 feet and out of sight of the rest of us.

Now the food: Skip it, just go eat somewhere else.

I did find the mongolian grill okay but the chef there was rude and testy with the other staff and the customers. The rest of the food was generally tasteless and gassy. We left feeling bloated and ripped off, and spent far too much time in the restroom the rest of the night!

The Italian section had moderately okay thin crust pizza.

We were staying here at the hotel and ate here out of convenience, for breakfast.  We were promptly seated and ordered our drinks.  It honestly seems like and average to below average breakfast buffet for Vegas.  Honestly, probably below average.  Probably the best thing they serve for breakfast is made to order omelets.  I didn't have the patience to wait in the long line though.  They had a nice big tray of bacon but is was so dried out and stuck together, you couldn't really pick up a piece without it either falling about or being about 6 strips.  The cheese blintzes were good.  Lots of pastries but honestly, they didn't look that appealing.  They also had pizza.  I suppose there is never really a bad time for pizza.  I would come back, but don't expect to be wowed with the food here.

No msg problem here, went yeaterday and today. 

The Prime rib was ok... as long as it is not over done I STILL LIKE IT. 

That was really all I wanted so I cannot omment on much other. 

They do have Mt Dew.

After watching several you tube reviews on the Suncoast Buffet I decided to hop on the WAX bus and give it a try. The beef roast was carved New York Strip loin. Very tender and delicious. The other  food stations were on par with the most Boyd buffets including a huge ice cream and desert section. You get a discount with the B Connected card. GOOD FOOD and GOOD SELECTION at a GOOD PRICE.

I rarely throw myself into the eye of a Carbohydrate Storm but it was FAT Tuesday and I was ready for the mass orgy of pastries, potatoes, pancakes and the diets most pole dancers fear! I must admit that I started this review pre-foodcoma and 4 hours later have now resumed to knock out my lists of goodies and baddies of the buffet.

First off, take 3 minutes to get your B Connected card at the BConnected station  and you knock off a dollar from your Buffet. It's worth the monetary benefits throughout the Casino and can earn you a free buffet of your choice in the future.

So I give it 5 stars for the value and the selection! It's as tasty as any regular run of the meal buffet in town and the service was fast and friendly.

The breakfast buffet is very well stocked almost a few days worth of food.  I am a French toastie (if you may...) and it was very good! I will say that for $6.99, you will not find a better breakfast. It's not fancy by any means in presentation or by selection but they did have eggs benedict and an omlet station. The extensive donuts, breakfast breads, patries, fruit tarts, gelato, fruit, waffles, meats, potatoes, crepes, omlets and eggs etc... was more than good enough for the pickiest of eaters. 

The waitstaff is wonderful and very conscientious of their customers with frequent drink refills and friendly chatter to make sure you enjoy your visit to the casino.  It's also not a bad place to people watch so get a booth that overlooks the casino floor. Ha!

This place has a great selection for an affordable price. The seafood in particular is great. Dessert also has a large selection compared to other buffets of similar price. My one gripe is the wait to get in. It took 30 minutes to get in and there was only like 10 people in front of me. The restaurant wasn't packed at all, so the only reason it could be slow was the cashiers. I almost went somewhere else to eat because of this.

Honestly? The food was pretty good. I went during the lunch set up, and I wasn't disappointed! They had really good turkey and pretty good mashed potatoes as well. 

Best thing they had though was the ice cream. I could've eaten that all day if I could lmao.

The lightning in the room was kinda dark though. I almost thought the place was closed lol. Overall, 4/5
One of my favourite seafood buffet in town on Friday night. All you can eat crab legs, oysters, seafood. Price is reasonable, cheaper than those seafood buffet on Las Vegas strip.

This is an okay buffet. I did not care to see a servers boyfriend sitting at a booth near us, with various staff members (two or three) sitting to chat with him. The food was fine, par for the course as far as buffets were concerned. I did like having a wide screen television to watch while dining. Don't see that too often in a buffet. If you find yourself in the Summerlin part of Las Vegas. This is a good buffet to go to. Otherwise, it's just another buffet.
Great food at a great price. Debbie was very accomodating for a large group. Attentive staff.  The hotel has large rooms, double sinks & great pillows.
Excellent best lunch around especially for b connected members.  Fresh variety  good food and excellent deserts

They say you can't eat the atmosphere, but you can.  So for this ambience, or lack thereof, I'm taking off two stars.  The place is dull, dreary, and needs a facelift.

But the food was very good.  Everything we tried was delicious.  We went because they had a special Rosh Hashanah buffet.  Nothing was switched, just added, so we feasted on chopped liver, gefilte fish, matzoh ball soup, brisket, potato knishes, tsimmes (sweet carrots and sweet potatoes,and whitefish salad.  My wife doesn't like this stuff, but I do, which is why we were there.  And that's in addition to all the regular buffet items, plus the wine that's included in the reasonable 12.99 price.  You can't cook it at this price.

We stuffed our faces and left filled and happy.

This buffet is under new management!

My parents who live in Vegas haven't been to the Suncoast buffet in years due to they said poor quality food.  I am their son and was staying there at the Suncoast.   My friend and I wanted to go to the Red Rock buffet but because my dad doesnt like to travel too far from his home(in Summerlin), my friend and I reluctantly agreed to go to their St. Tropez Buffet.  She told me, well, get ready to not eat cause it was awful the last time I ate there.  I had not eaten there or if I did, I don't remember it which means to me, it was okay but nothing I would do again.

All the dishes I had were very good, and our server was xcellent!l.  He remembered my parents and asked why they stopped coming, and I said because of your food.  Then I was told they r under new management, and I met one of the managers named Andrew to talk to him. He said they have been and still are putting in a lot of time and effort to turn around this declining buffet so. . . 

If u have written off the St.Tropez buffet at the Suncoast in the past due to whatever reasons which I'm sure were legitimate at the time, I say give it another chance.  U might be pleasantly surprised!
 
Oh, and I'm super glad my parents who r retired and now 87 and 81 have another place to eat close to them.  That makes two. Lol

James

Ew ew ew. Did I mention ew? We had eaten here about 7 years ago and when we had to come to Vegas for a family emergency, we stayed at the Suncoast. We grabbed a bite to eat at the buffet and it was just plain bad. 

The variety of dishes is awkward - why is there a cabbage-based dish at nearly every station?! The only thing I "liked" (I use quotations because liked is loosely used here) was the collard greens. The taco meat wasn't bad. The potato knish was just a ball 'o pepper. The stuffing was tasteless. 

I'm a "hit 'em were it hurts" person with buffets, opting for the more expensive dishes like meats and such. I ended up resorting to a dinner roll and some extremely dry fried chicken. 

If this is your only option and you need to eat somewhere convenient, then fine. But there is a TGI Friday's about 100 feet away and I am sure your $13.99 (or $8.99 if you're a member of the player's club) would be much better spent and enjoyed. Or go across the casino floor to the deli and grab a reuben and a black & white cookie.

Again, 3.5 stars.  (And I say that the same way Jay Rayner says the hoff in 3.5).  

Basic, locals buffet.  The food was good.  The glazed carrots were a bit too sweet, but I made up for it by having sugar free desserts.  :)

The prime rib was excellent again, and I liked the catfish and chicken sausages.  The egg roll was very good.

Service was very quick and Rafael was quite nice.  The place was almost empty.  Wow, are they hurting for business.

A good value considering we had two free buffets.

PS:  I added some photos because  the poor little place had not yet had any posted so I had to take the camera and get some for Yelp.  Some people looked at me like I had two heads, but it's their problem.

I've been here about a year ago. I must admit, it was horrible! Although, a friend told me that the suncoast had made changes for the better.... So she brought me there. At first I was hesitant, but when we got there I was utterly surprised with all the changes! Great Job Suncoast!!!! Food and presentation is 100x times better!!! Service and managers were all inviting! The Chef came to our table Friday Night (they called it "seafood night") and we had to complement her and her staff with all the changes that was done. Crab legs were plump with meat! Amazing!!! Job well done!

My sons and I wanted to go see a movie today and thought we would give this buffet a shot.  Waited in line to pay and come to find out they charge Childeren full price on buffets but only offer their card discount to gamblers.  Fuck you suncoast.

Pretty standard buffet fare.  Really, nothing extra special here.

Came here one day for lunch with the fam because I had a coupon (yay for being a Club Coast playa) and for the price, a reasonable $7.99 a person.  It's ok for a quick lunch buffet with most of the general fixings.

You got your American, Mexican, Italian, Chinese, salad bar, and dessert station all represented here.  I gotta say though for me the standout is the Mongolian station.  Damn, they make a fine stir-fry!  Really, it is way better than those you see at the local Chinese buffets.  I swear it must be the sauce!  The sauce is boss!  Pick your veggies and your protein of choice (I always go beef and shrimp) and it gets Mongolian-ed right in front of you!  That soy sauce concoction they use really makes it though.  It's got the right taste, salty, sweet, a bit tangy...it's very good.  Helps too if the veggies and meat are fresh.

The other plus I've found here is that they serve Stuffed Cabbage!  Yep, I love me some old school, down-home cookin'.  Only buffet I know so far that serves it.  May not be like Mom used to make, but it'll do in a buffet pinch.  Brings me back home!

Other than that, the food here is average.  The place is pretty clean and the service is speedy but polite.  You may want to watch the food however, some things looks like they sat out under the heat lamp for a good bit.  Soggy pizza?  No thank you!

The gelato station was a nice touch with some interesting flavors.  The blood orange was tart and sweet, so nice.  My fav though was the coconut, always a plus to end my buffet jaunt.  

If you're cheap and broke like me, St. Tropez is not a bad way to go.  It's no Bellagio or Wynn buffet, or even a Station Casino buffet for that matter...but it sure beats a stale hot dog and some Top Ramen!

I've been here 3 times and the food was always good as far as buffets go but I never had the Mongolian bbq, but after I did I'm not going back to anywhere else I mean this Mongolian rivals if not  beats many of the outside restaurants I found in china town I mean it was that good. The dessert option is a little crummy but hey there's delicious gelato places by my house, So no complaints there. Prices change for specialty dinners and champagne brunch but weekdays lunch is $6.99 and $5.00 on Tuesday.

I don't think they're even trying to make good tasting food. Actually, I would be surprised if anything was cooked from a recipe and not microwaved or warmed in an oven from a pre-made bag. It was awful. I know you can't expect much from a cheap, Vegas buffet, but it would be nice if they tried.

We came here for Father's Day.  After paying with tax and tip for four of us (discounted), it was $85.

I hate to say that compared to other buffets I have eaten at my whole life growing up in Vegas, this one rates the worst (at least in memory).  The food didn't even look appealing and was a little dried out due to heat lamps. After the "meal", I tried a piece of lemon meringue pie and after stripping off the leathery meringue, it was manageable.  This was typical of the meal.

The only saving grace was the wait staff who were very attentive with plate clearing and drink filling. 

When popping open yelp and pulling this restaurant up, the two stars I saw was no shock but well deserved.

This place not a good way to spend your money especially during their Christmas buffet the staff does not care about you the food is similar to the average buffet but much more expensive the food is decent the sushi is bs the cashier was rude don't come here for holiday buffets you do not get what you pay for the soup is too salty very good if you want high blood pressure and heart problems the the hot chocolate is too sweet and the prime ribs are bland the desert section is bad the only thing good was the waiting staff I would give this place 0 stars if I could

Champagne brunch Sunday on Memorial Day weekend. Place was kinda dead, which was already a bad sign.

This buffet offers food that you'd expect from a local casino buffet. Familiar foods, catering toward the elderly slot-playing zombie-like clientele. Sure, with older customers, it's important to remember that their palettes have disintegrated to the point that taste buds can't tell whether they are eating breaded cardboard or a Filet-o-Fish patty... and the food available represented that.  I already walked in with low expectations, but walked out even more disappointed.

The good? Cream puffs at the dessert station
The decent? Apple crepes, pizza, tater tots, champagne
The bad? Everything else. Most of the protein dishes had little to no flavor, while also being as dry as the food I try to create in my kitchen. My cooking skills are comparable to a 4 year old with a Play-Doh imagination kitchen.

I'm not really one to hate on local casino quality, but this stuff was some of the worst food that I've had in a long time. Please use your money somewhere else. The Cafe, or even Fridays has much better food for roughly the same price.

Really very bad. Its mostly for old people. Low salt and low sugar diet. Also very expensive for kids. My kids are small and they don't even eat that much. Don't come here this is a warning unless you want to waste your money. If you're the type who can eat a lot then go ahead. Otherwise, you can go to an a la carte restaurant and be satisfied for  less amount of money.

Tried this buffet for the first time and were pleasantly surprised. It is not crowded at all, yet very inexpensive.  Food was pretty good, good variety and good quality.  The servers are pretty attentive and friendly.  The cashiers have some room to improve their customer service skills. Overall a positive experience.
Nice buffet , the price is cheap ($8 for lunch), large choice (salads, mongolian, bbq, chinese, italian, desserts)

I love this place!!

This is for breakfast only!

Lemme start off by saying, I do like buffets, but that doesnt make me an unclassy eater! LOL. Anyway, we go here bc its close to my apartment and its semi cheap! Its 7.99$ with your Bconnected card so its not too bad. We normally go to breakfast bc they have a giant selection of yummy food!!

I usually start off with getting an omelet, the man there is such a sweetie and actually knows how to make them!! Not browned!! LOL! I get the ham, cheese, spinach, and mushrooms and theyre always cooked to perfection! Next I go and get, if they have, TATER TOTS!! What bufett do you know that has tater tots?! I also get Jewish with it and get some potato latkes! then a slither of chicken fried steak!!Aand I finally get a bagel.

Here they have a ton of diff food: chile quiles, taquitos, breakfast strombolis, pizza, bacon, sausage, waffles, pancakes, french toast, loxs and bagels, and soooo much more. They have a great sugar free dessert selection and a lot of fruits and veggies!!

Go here for some yummy treats and then you can play and chat with a lil old grandpa and listen to their stories!

Overpriced for children. Dinner $16.99 with no options other than pizza and spaghetti. They have An American BBQ section but no hamburgers, hot doges etc.  The deserts....slices of cakes were hard and stale.

At least they had a small salad bar and ice cream for the kids.

Mon-Thu, play 400 points on your b-connected card, get a free breakfast or lunch buffet. Earn another 400 points and get another breakfast and lunch buffet for yourself.

There are 2 entrance lines, Emerald and higher card holders enter on the right, everyone else on the left.

Mongolian bbq, Chinese, American grill, carving station, Italian, Mexican, dessert, fruit & veggie bar and an ice cream case selections that will be scooped for you.

For the price and flavor, it was good to easily access the buffet with standard but tasty dishes.

Had a perfectly edible lunch yesterday at the St. Tropez.  Armed with our American Casino Guide coupon, my family stopped here because we happened to be in the neighborhood.

Salad was not extensive, but what was there was fresh.  The marinated artichokes are a highlight.

Most of the hot foods appear to be of standard mid-level buffet quality:  Generally edible, but rarely exquisite.  One standout is the Spicy tofu: normally I don't like tofu, because it is so bland. However this added enough flavor to make it taste good.

Also, they have a gelato bar, which turns an otherwise uninspired dessert station into one worth stopping at.  I recommend the blood orange, coconut, chocolate, and pistachio flavors.

I'm not sure which marketing intern came up with the name "St. Tropez Buffet," but the only thing similar that I could find to anything having to do with the French Riviera was the fact that the deli station offers cheese.  However, none of the cheeses appear to be French in any way.  I believe every restaurant should have at least some vague connection to its namesake.  (For example, the Orleans French Market buffet sometimes has crawdads.)  I've never been to St. Tropez, France, but I know enough about this buffet that it has no resemblance to St. Tropez in any conceivable way.  This patent disregard for its inspiration cost the St. Tropez buffet 1/2 star in my rating.

We went for free lunch buffet using a coupon from Bingo.  They were located in the Suncoast Casino on Alta Dr in Las Vegas.

There were 6 international stations: Mongolian, Seafood, Chinese, BBQ American, Mexican, and Italian.  There were 2 salad/fruit stations and a dessert station.

The fresh fruit was good.  I wouldn't pay for the meal and probably won't be back.

I came here with a group of friends and because one of the friends parents is a local here in Vegas and we were staying at their place, they insisted to take us out for dinner. Local constantly get coupon in the mail for this casino. It's located really far in the suburb. With coupon per person for dinner was less than $10. There are lots of choices but the food was pretty disgusting. You are better off having burger. Again this place is inside a casino meaning it's smoky. But then this casino is not busy which also means plenty of parking spots.

This place has lots of choices bit nothing really edible. Don't recommend it.
Aside from the really big line ( which is pretty common for seafood Fridays). Good food and friendly staff.

I would give no stars.... First of all fathers day special.. no special food... it was a nasty crap. Worst buffet in las vegas. The mongolian area, cook didn't clean his cooking grill and i had black chips of burnt chips in my food. No good selections of food. Every thing looked like it was sitting out all day.. No fresh food!!! No tastes at all. Nothing was good.  It is the WORST BUFFET!!!  I recommened NOT going to eat here at all!!!!!

We decided to try the champagne breakfast. I kind of enjoyed the food. My wife didn't enjoy it at all. She complained her stomach hurt after 30 minutes. I enjoyed the omelet station, but everybody has an omelet station. The had fried catfish which was ok, the prime rib was ok. I enjoyed the soft service ice cream and all the donuts they had for breakfast. We ate the cafe last time we stayed here and spent the same amount as the buffet. 

I would of rated it 3 stars, but my wife made me remove a star for her stomach ache.

WORST BUFFET IN VEGAS!!! I have had buffets all over Las Vegas. Went here for the 1st time yesterday because I had a coupon for a free buffet. As a couple we paid for one overpriced buffet we wished we stayed away from. Could not have been worse. What kind of buffet that has prime rib and turkey does not have dinner rolls or any type of bread other then garlic bread? The Turkey was cold and undercooked. Every item I tried tasted older then dirt. The dessert selection was thin unless you want sugarless desserts. This buffet closes at 8pm supposedly but at 7:40pm the employees are already focused on removing items and cleaning up. The servers don't return to the table much because they are prepping to leave. Even the drinks were bad. The cups smelled like old dishwater. This is the worst buffet I have ever been to in Las Vegas. Save yourself the frustration and go to the Red Rock buffet its about the same price and does not close 20minutes before the posted closing time.

My bf and I came here and I think this was the best buffet I have been to. Unlimited wine and beer!..Didnt have any but the food was really good for being buffet style. Steak was perfect, they had a variety of food. The dessert part was the best. White Chocolate Gelato!!...that was the bomb!..mmmmmmm

First time since three years ago, not bad for only $13.99 on a Friday night, seafood chowder and clam chowder worth the price already, Asian chicken wings are the best, salad selection just ok. Craving station were acceptable, overall it worth the price we paid for.

Hands down, probably the worst buffet that I've ever been to. Terrible seating - every time someone walks by you, they brush up against you. It's like eating on a crowded bus. Why people continue to come here is beyond me. There are better choices all over Vegas. Prime Rib? How about sub-prime? The meat was so tough that I thought I was chewing beef jerky. They need some kind of quality control here. The food looked like it was thrown together by a 5-year old. If I ever come here again, it will probably be because I am drunk and don't know where I am.

come on Tuesday, it is $5.00 day for everyone with a player card, good for breakfast and lunch only, I like their seafood section, which they put crab leg, mussels, shrimp, sausage, potatoes, corn all cook in a spicy soup...for this price, u can't beat that

I have noticed a big change in the quality of food as well as the service over the recent months. The manager Debbie seems to really have things moving in the right direction and is always pleasant to speak with. I have also found that the server Jorge is the best server I've ever had wait on us here in Vegas. If you haven't eaten here in a while I suggest you go back and you'll be glad you did. Great food at a great price!
Debbie is very nice and has very good customer service. The food was amazing and the waitresses were good and made sure our meal was satisfying.

I went to Brunch at 11:30 and they have all pricing on a sign out front. Particularly the issue is with this

-21 years and under $13.99 Sunday (11-3)

The cashier charged for my son $17.99 after I stated he was under 21. I told her what the sign stated and she says "i'm suppose to believe he is under 21" . He then pulled out his drivers license for her to see. Excuse me I politely stated , why would have the need to lie? She then just looked down and stated that the sign she has on her register says $17.99 after she looked at the sign. The young lady was rude and since I didn't want to argue with her, we walked away.
I immediately called to speak with the manager and spoke with Vanessa ( shift supervisor) who apologized on her behalf about 3 times. I told Vanessa if the sign is wrong , you need to remove it. Vanessa says she will "handle it"... 

I wanted to try the restaurant as I was hungry. The restaurant needs to remove the sign because they have been overcharging customers all day or the young lady was just trying to over charge us?

This is one of my favorite buffets.  Great selection of food -- and the quality is pretty decent.  I'm giving it 5 stars compared to a lot of bad buffets out there...and you can always count on the quality and consistency of the Suncoast's buffet.  The staff is also super duper friendly.  The beverage service is the only negative, usually slow and disinterested.  The prices are reasonable -- and seem lower than most buffets.  The hours have been reduced the past year or so -- so its not open very late.  Worth a trip nevertheless!

Looks like there's a new warden in town! I have to say they really upped their game. The quality and attention to detail has improved dramatically. Even the desserts taste better. Nicely done, whoever is responsible for the turnaround. For the money, it's a really good deal as they have many tasty dishes. The staff seems happier too. It's probably closer to a 4 star buffet, but considering the very reasonable price and how they've improved so much, it seemed a crime not to give them the big five!

We come here for breakfast about every other weekend and it's always good service, food is good (not great by any means but definitely nothing to complain about) The selection is huge and for $6.99 it's cheaper then goin to ihop or dennys etc.  Oh and I love that they have churros available (I love those things)  Also they offer lox which is pretty nice considering the price of the buffet.

Not a bad buffet, it's a great value for $20, which includes a really good prime rib on Saturday night.  It's soft and tender and way better than the one at Wicked Spoon which will cost you about double.

Unfortunately, the other items are so-so and nothing noteworthy. Skip the lobster tail add-on, it's not worth it.  We got that because both of my friends are Emerald status and got a gigantic credit to pay for this.

Yesterday we had lunch there, and I was impressed. Lots of choices,5 different fish options, veggies, potatoes, italian, chinese, selections, potstickers, desserts, salads, soups.  All were very good.  Lots of food at a very modest price. Drinks too.. MOngolian stuff.

I have a quick tip that says something about turkey, but those were my hubbie's sentiments. What I wanted to say in my quick tip is this: "Hide the free buffet coupons from your husband." Yes, that is my quick tip.

Of course, I should be fair and say that for my belly all buffets are pretty much one star, unless they're Indian. As a result of some free coupons that showed up in the mail, however, I have eaten lunch at St. Tropez twice now. By the end of the second trip, my husband and I were joking that we should establish a buffet rating system based on how many things you end up spitting out. Yes, that is juvenile, but we thought it was rather funny, especially after he spit out like the 4th thing. 

Personally, I only spit out one thing: some foul tasting steamed broccoli. I am sorry, but it tasted like poop. I survived my trips to the buffet with the following: noodles from the "Asian" section, some cold salads, baked sweet potatoes and some bean tacos (hold the guacamole because it was brown on the first trip), and some pretty good Chinese broccoli. Even the salad bar was a little disappointing because there were no mixed greens. A fabulous salad bar could earn a star upgrade from me. The sweets section is enticing, but the rice crispy treats were stale. How anticlimactic. The bright spot is the staff as they are definitely cheerful and hardworking! It is cheap too I suppose.

Again, if you want a buffet lover's opinion, this is not it, but even with the free coupons, we don't have plans for a third visit. I am not a one star kinda lady, but in the service of honesty, I have to go there.

I agree with many other Yelpers regarding the service. In my opinion this is the very worst buffet in terms of food quality. Usually the carving station is the center piece of any buffet,  I felt this was the area that needs the greatest improvement. The quality of the meats was very poor.

We came here on a Tuesday for their lunch buffet. With a B-Connected card, a Buffet is 8.99. We used the Casino Guide Bogo and paid $10.72. 

- I'd opt for the Feast Buffet at a Station Casino. Similar lunch price but Feast has a better selection and tastier quality. 
- Items you can't go wrong with: beef tacos, fried chicken
- The Chinese food selection wasn't appetizing at all. Panda can do a better job. 
- I don't recommend getting soups here. Broken noodles. Messy. 
- fast service with drink refills. 
- Pistachio ice cream was good. The donuts were a bit hard. 
- Even with a coupon, I wouldn't give this place another try.

My friends wanted to eat someplace near the house we rented and we ended up at the St. Tropez International Buffet, despite my protests. The buffet featured a wide variety of different foods, including pizzas and pastas, tacos and other Mexican dishes, Mongolian BBQ, and much more. Everything was very average quality and taste. We didn't leave hungry but I wasn't satisfied with the meal. Would not recommend.

Yesterday was our 2nd time in 12 yrs. at Suncoast Buffet, the 1st being for breakfast (the meal nobody can mess up) & went because someone gave us their free coupons.   It was 5:00 and we figured at this hour everything would be fresh and hot.  Wrong assumption!  On every section (Chinese, Mongolian hotpot, Italian, BBQ) the food was lukewarm.  The hot & sour soup wasn't even that.  I won't itemize each item I sampled, but I found nothing to be palatable.  Their salad bar doesn't look fresh, has very few items, & appears like Las Vegas in the fifties.  The Chinese section is pitiful, with overcooked veggies, dried up noodles & a poor selection.  The Italian is not your grandma's kitchen... thick, over-cheesed pizza, a mushy lasagna, a very boring pesto over cold bowtie pasta.  The BBQ section was serving up steak, dark turkey meat & one more item.  I tried the turkey, but didn't have a second bite.  There is ONE kind of bread which had garlic on it, was cold & hard from sitting too long.  The Mongolian section I skipped because there were only "cheap" choices, like tiny cuts of carrots, bean sprouts, onions, green peppers, & the "meat" of chicken, shrimp & pork was in the back so you couldn't see it until they cooked everything.  Desserts?  My partner tried 3 of them & said they were tasteless & the cover-up was too much whipped cream.

I spoke to the manager about the total lack of hot food & she said she'd call the chef who finally emerged to tell me all the burners are on hot, there is no problem whatsoever; that she couldn't believe I found all that food to be lukewarm.  We left in frustration and chose to never return.

With all of the buffet competition in this town, how can Suncoast/Summerlin serve up such an inferior buffet?  And to imply that we don't know how to tell if food is hot or cold is a real insult.

This has got to be one of the worst buffets! They don't have a big selection or anything good to choose from.
The only time I go anymore is on Friday nights when they have crablegs, but even then it's bad! I'm going to post a pic of what their crablegs looked like....my finger was bigger than each leg! It was AWEFUL! You pay $40 for 2 people for this crap? Their soaking in water, so the shell is soft, therefore impossible to crack..it just bends. Then you can't get the little bit of meat that's in there cause it sticks to the sides...it was just a mess! I'm not paying $40 for that! And they also smelled very fishy....gross! I'm going back to Ramparts seafood buffet ...theirs is excellent ! Fire that chef at suncoast...he should be ashamed of himself putting crap out like that on the buffet!

Great improvement at the buffet , as promised. We went with a 2-1 promo and were not disappointed. The egg foo young was light and better than the local take outs. The beef and broccoli was tender. The salad bar was ample. Baby bok choi is delicious. The veggies were not soaked in oil like they are at Red Rock. Great dessert selections. Way better than Red Rock desserts. The hubby enjoyed sweet and sour white meat chicken. It had big chunks of chicken. Good lunch option for locals.  

New comments:
I am sorry to report that the price went up a dollar and the quality went down a notch. Please pay attention. I miss the gluten free chocolate cheesecake which was outstanding. Dessert choices today were limited. The sauce for the egg foo young has changed. Bring back the brown sauce. The bok choy was overcooked. I was happy to see corned beef but teach your staff how to slice against the grain. We love coming here for lunch so please bring back quality control.

It's not intended to be the high end buffet you would find at a 5 star hotel on the strip.  I came here for breakfast on a Tuesday morning.  Best part was the price.  $8 if you have a players card (it takes 5 minutes to sign up for free).  $11 without the players card.

Breakfast service is a full buffet with everything you would expect, including a omelet station and honey ham caring station.  Things you might not expect are a taco bar, complete with sour cream and fresh guacamole; various types of pizza; a salad bar; and a desert station with cheesecakes, cobblers, etc. bright and early.  But how does it all taste?  Drum roll... okay at best.

Finally, the staff here are really friendly.  I definitely suggest you eat here for value if you stay at Suncoast Hotel & Casino.  I would never drive out of my way to eat here.

If I could give zero stars I would.  The food is awful.  Frozen pizza and t.v. dinners taste better.  The plates are dirty.  The cashiers are beyond unfriendly.  The older blonde supervisor or manager is a complete disrespectful and rude witch who should not be dealing with customers.  She should be fired.  The only thing that saves this buffet is that some waiters and bus people are very nice.  Otherwise don't bother eating here.  You should have a hot dog at 7-11 instead.

Food is alright here at suncoast buffet. This buffet has been going on since the day this casinos opened. Their selection of food is pretty decent. Nothing different with each genre of food here. Just the typical Chinese food or Mexican food like tacos. The only area surprises me is the Mangolian food where they can cook you the food right on their Grill. You just have to choose your own toppings. 

Once again I only go here with the family since they do have good discounts for being a member at the casino. They also offer some coupons like 2 for 1. Just get yourself a players card and you can get them in the mail.

This is the saddest buffet I've ever been to in my entire life. It was awful. The quality was sub-par at best, and disgusting at worst. Various sauces had a thick, congealed layer on them, shrimp were covered in a gooey mess and everything felt dirty. A party of 7 came with me before we went bowling for my birthday and it was just a whomp-whomp sort of meal. I have no desire to go back.

Had our 'once per trip' buffet tonight and my son choose this one. To my surprise I was pretty darn good. First off, the staff was super friendly and welcoming. The waitress who served our drinks and cleaned our plates was great and always kept our drinks filled. I also had a coupon for a free glass of house wine and they were VERY generous...

The salad bar was well stickers and had a good variety. The Mongolian BBQ area had a good selection and was delicious. The Chinese and Italian sections were less than stellar.  They

Also, price was great for a buffet-16.99 per adult. Overall, one of the better less fancy buffets I've been to.

Came here during a stay at the hotel for work and ate here for the sake of convenience lunch and breakfast.  The desserts are probably the highlight of the place.
